importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: Kada Scott was reported missing on this date, and a stolen Hyundai Accent was reportedly seen at a recreation center on this day, linking it to her disappearance.
The remains of Kada Scott were discovered on this date, and a news conference was held by District Attorney Larry Krasner to announce the findings and charges.
An initial tip led investigators to the abandoned school, though no remains were found at that time.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The stolen vehicle was reported on this date and seen at a recreation center, which became a key piece of evidence tying Keon King to Kada Scott’s disappearance.

keyTakeAways: The remains of Kada Scott, a 23-year-old woman missing for two weeks, were found behind an abandoned school in Philadelphia.
DNA testing confirmed the identity of the remains, confirming Scott's death.
Keon King, 21, of Dover, Delaware, has been arrested and charged with kidnapping, stalking, arson, conspiracy, and causing or risking a catastrophe.
King’s cellphone had locations linked to Scott’s disappearance, and video evidence shows his vehicle being parked near the area where Scott’s body was found.
A stolen black Hyundai Accent was seen on video on Oct. 4 and later burned at a junkyard, with investigators noting its connection to the case.
Prosecutors say more charges are in the works and that other individuals may have been involved after the fact.
King was previously arrested in a separate kidnapping case, with charges dropped due to lack of court appearance by the victim and witness.
Kada Scott was working in an assisted living facility and was reported missing after leaving an overnight shift.
Her parents described her as a source of light, kindness, and beautiful spirit, and expressed that their hearts were shattered by her disappearance.

namedEntities.name: Kada Scott
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A 23-year-old woman who was missing for about two weeks.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Her remains were found behind an abandoned school, confirming her death and prompting a major investigation into her disappearance and possible foul play.

namedEntities.name: Keon King
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A 21-year-old man from Dover, Delaware, arrested and charged in connection with Kada Scott’s disappearance.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He has been charged with kidnapping, stalking, arson, and conspiracy, and his cellphone locations and vehicle sightings tie him directly to the case.

namedEntities.name: District Attorney Larry Krasner
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The lead prosecutor in Philadelphia overseeing the investigation and charges related to Kada Scott’s case.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He confirmed that homicide charges are likely, emphasized legal process and constitutional obligations, and announced additional charges against Keon King.

namedEntities.name: Ashley Toczylowski
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A prosecutor who provided details about the investigation, including tips and video evidence.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: She explained how a follow-up tip led investigators to the remains and described the presence of video evidence linking King to Scott’s disappearance.

namedEntities.name: black Hyundai Accent
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A stolen vehicle seen on video near the recreation center on Oct. 4, and later burned at a junkyard.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It was reported stolen one day before Scott’s disappearance and was seen parked near where her body was found, providing critical circumstantial evidence.

namedEntities.name: abandoned school
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A location behind which the remains of Kada Scott were found.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It served as the site of discovery, and investigators previously searched there without success until a new tip prompted a return.

namedEntities.name: Dover, Delaware
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It provides context to King’s location and background, especially since he was arrested and previously released in another case.

namedEntities.name: assisted living facility
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It provides context for her final known activity and helps establish a timeline of her last known whereabouts before vanishing.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The remains of Kada Scott, a 23-year-old woman reported missing after an overnight shift at an assisted living facility, were discovered in a shallow grave behind an abandoned school in Philadelphia. The discovery was prompted by an anonymous tip that led investigators to re-examine the area. DNA testing confirmed her identity. Keon King, a 21-year-old man from Dover, Delaware, was arrested and charged with kidnapping, stalking, arson, conspiracy, and causing or risking a catastrophe. His cellphone data and video footage show his vehicle, a stolen black Hyundai Accent, being parked near the site where Scott’s body was found. The car was later burned at a junkyard. Prosecutors say more charges may be filed and that others may have been involved. King was previously arrested in a separate case, with charges dropped due to non-appearance of key witnesses. District Attorney Larry Krasner confirmed that homicide charges are likely, emphasizing legal process and constitutional standards.
title: Remains Found Behind Abandoned School Belong to Missing Philadelphia Woman, Kada Scott
